conbody.p: The Network panel contains the Topology, Collections and Saved Searches tabs. Refresh the Network Explorer for latest information in the network panel
Note : Items selected in the Network panel tabs are retained when navigating between the tabs.

section.title: Topology Tab
section.p: The topology tab contains subNetworks, nodes, and the All other nodes item. Supported Nodes are found under the All other nodes item unless they are added beneath subNetworks. The Topology tab is used to select the required node(s) or collection of nodes.
Note: Click the refresh icon to fetch the latest list of nodes and/or collections.
The Network Panel shows the number of MeContext and ManagedElement child nodes under a SubNetwork or Collection.

Find and Locate Node(s) is to search for a node inside a Topology, click on the icon next to the refresh button. Once the icon is clicked, a search bar and navigation arrow buttons (up and down) will be displayed. Clicking the icon again hides the search bar and the navigation buttons.

Within the text input, searching nodes by its partial or full name is supported.However, note that the search text is case-sensitive. For example, when searching for a node with the name 'NR01gNodeBRadio00001', 'NR*' may be used.

Note the following ways of how partial text search can be used:
To search for a node with a name starting with 'NR', 'NR*' must be used.
To search for a node with '01' anywhere in the name, then search '01' without the * symbol.
Enter the search text and click on the up/down arrow buttons. When clicked, the first node with the matching text will be located and selected in the specified Topology tree.
If there are multiple nodes found with the given search text, the user can locate them using the up or down arrow buttons.

From Topology Drop down, select SubNetwork or Node from Network Data or Custom Topology Collection.
Select a SubNetwork from the Network Data, the SubNetwork Child Nodes associated to MeContext or ManagedElement are shown in results Page
Select a SubNetwork from the Network Data, the SubNetwork not having direct MeContext or ManagedElement nodes are shown in results Page as below.
Select a node from the SubNetwork or All other Nodes to display the details in results Page
Select Collection to display the saved contents in the results page. If no contents, shown as empty.
When Apply Recursively check box is selected, the Result table displays every Node under every Collection in the selected collection.
if apply recursively is not selected, direct child nodes of the selected collection will get display in the Result table.
if apply recursively is checked, when a object is selected in the result table then 'Remove form this collection' button is not shown
if apply recursively is unchecked, when a object is selected in the result table them 'Remove form this collection' button is shown
section.b: Right Click Actions On Selected Objects
section.p: Actions enable you to perform operations on network objects. ENM supports actions across all application sets. When objects are selected from the Topology Tab of Network Panel, there are 2 ways to perform actions on them:
1. Right click on the object to display a list of all actions in contextMenu that can be performed on that object
2. Click the buttons in the Action Bar
Actions displayed on the below use cases on Right click event.

ul.li: SubNetwork from Network Data hierarchy under Topology tab of Network Panel
Node from Network Data hierarchy under from Topology tab of Network Panel
Child MO from Network Data hierarchy under Topology tab of Network Panel
Collection from Transport Topology tree under Topology Tab from Network Panel
Hybrid Collection from Transport Topology tree under Topology Tab from Network Panel

Some actions such as Locate in Topology only support a single MO. Other actions such as Launch AMOS and Launch Element Manager only support node level objects like NetworkElement, MeContext and ManagedElement.
All objects are not supported by all applications. If the selected object is not supported try the following:

ul.li:
Refine your search. For example:
select all objects of type NetworkElement where NetworkElement has child CmFunction and CmFunction has attr syncStatus = SYNCHRONIZED from node type ERBS

It is also possible to use Topology Browser to find the root object and launch the required application from Topology Browser, by performing the following steps:
In Network Explorer, right click on an object, then click Locate in Topology in the Action Bar/ contextMenu. The object you have selected in Network Explorer will be highlighted in Topology Browser. Scroll up until you reach the root object. The root object will be a node level object such as NetworkElement, MeContext or ManagedElement. Click the root object, then click the required action from the Action Bar.

section.title: Collections Tab
section.p: The Collection tab displays a list of available collections, only one collection can be selected. When the collection is selected the contents saved are displayed in the results page and by selecting check box, the details of the selected node from results will be shown in the Details Panel.

The following filters can be applied to the list of collections:
The All button lists all available collections.
The Public button lists all public collections.
The Private button lists all private collections.
The input box beside the filter buttons enables you to filter by name.
The Favorites button enables you to filter collections marked as favorite.
The Collection table can be refreshed by clicking the refresh icon .This is displayed in the top right hand corner of the table. visible in the top right hand corner of the table.

section.title: Saved Searches Tab
section.p: The Saved Searches tab displays a list of all available saved search queries, only one saved search can be selected. When the saved search is selected the contents applicable to the search are displayed in the results page and by selecting check box, the details of the selected node from results will be shown in the Details Panel.

The following filters can be applied to the list of saved searches:
The All button lists all available saved searches.
The Public button lists all public saved searches.
The Private button lists all private saved searches.
The input box beside the filter buttons enables you to filter by name.
The Favorites button enables you to filter saved searches marked as favorite.
The Saved search management table will display newly created Saved searches when you click the Refresh Button.
